title: Mapping the Deprived Visual System: Cracking function for prediction
descriptions: The "Mapping the Deprived Visual System: Cracking function for prediction" (MADVIS) project aims to investigate the impact of visual deprivation on the organization and connectivity of the occipital cortex. By understanding how different stages of visual deprivation affect brain regions and their function, this project seeks to predict outcomes of sight restoration procedures. The project will study the relationship between crossmodal plasticity and sight recovery using interdisciplinary methods from cognitive neurosciences and ophthalmology. The expected impact of MADVIS includes advancing knowledge of experience-dependent brain shaping, bridging the gap between crossmodal reorganization and sight restoration, and developing new tools for predicting sensory restoration outcomes. Ultimately, this project will provide insights into how specific brain regions adapt to the absence of visual input and leverage this understanding to improve predictions for sight restoration procedures.
